description:
From our law office in Ellensburg, Washington, the attorneys at Abeyta Nelson Injury Law are fully prepared to help you protect your rights and interests and increase your chances of obtaining the maximum amount of compensation you deserve for the injuries and losses you suffered as the result of someone else's negligence or wrongdoing.

Voted the Best Law Firm and Best Personal Injury Law Firm by the readers of the Yakima Herald-Republic and Best Attorney by the Yakima Valley Business Times, we are one of the region's top legal practices for personal injury law. Since our founding in 1981, we have recovered millions of dollars in settlements and awards for our plaintiff clients, and we have more than 135 years of combined legal experience to help guide you through these trying times.

Along with our local recognition, we have received national recognition for our impeccable professionalism and service, including recognition from Best Lawyers®, The National Trial Lawyers and Martindale-Hubbell as well as lifetime memberships in the Million Dollar Advocates Forum. More importantly, we have earned the respect and trust of our clients as evidenced by our Superb client ratings on AVVO and the numerous client testimonials and referrals we receive.

We have achieved this success through our unwavering dedication to those we serve, and our law firm strives to provide the highest level of personalized counsel throughout all legal proceedings to improve the likelihood our clients will achieve the positive results they seek. To find out more about how we can best assist you with your personal injury claim, you can contact Abeyta Nelson Injury Law by phone or through our website to schedule a free initial consultation, and we will not require a fee unless we win your case.

*AV®, AV Preeminent®, Martindale-Hubbell Distinguished and Martindale-Hubbell Notable are certification marks used under license in accordance with the Martindale-Hubbell certification procedures, standards and policies. Martindale-Hubbell® is the facilitator of a peer review rating process. Ratings reflect the anonymous opinions of members of the bar and the judiciary. Martindale-Hubbell® Peer Review RatingTM fall into two categories - legal ability and general ethical standards.
